intro: Boechera puberula, commonly known as the rough rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in open, sunny environments. Its small, yellow flowers appear in early spring, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Boechera puberula is often found in alpine or arctic regions, where it adapts to cold and harsh conditions.
